channel.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
channel.description:
I was just reading through JaGeX's Questions and Answers page for runescape, and it stated that.
Pur35 Ownage asks; Would there ever be a console version on RuneScape like for xbox360 + PS3, i think that they would be a great success if you could get the controls right, but they would have to speak not type which is much better. Yes, indeed, we are looking at all the consoles at the moment and deciding which one or two are best for our community.
I myself was pretty surprised by this, what do you guys think? :) Could be fun, lol.

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Sounds weird, it would be something i have to get used to.

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:47, topic:293572”][quote author=xeez` link=topic=388440.msg2906434#msg2906434 date=1249834800]

Hmm yeah.

I was just thinking, in games like CoD4, there’s only 12 people in one game.
Surely having 2000 people on one server on a console would be, uh, laggy?

I don’t have a clue really.
[/quote]I suppose that they would have servers that are limited to be played only by console-users.

cod is an fps though, and needs real time movement and low latency to work. runescape doesnt[/quote]
this
also MAG on the PS3 is going to have 256 players which is also an FPS. So if they can deal with heavy load of 256 players on a more complex game something like runescape would be fine

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Probably buy a disc with the “game” on it, but it would actually be the client, update the walking system, Make the way players face different positions more smooth. Probably some skills system like final fantasy/balders gate. Use the joystick to cycle through tabs, X/A for select(equivalent to a mouse click on an interface), Circle/B to close all open interfaces, then walking handled like a normal RPG. Similar to final fantasy.

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:44, topic:293572"]Would they make a whole new walking system? or would we just walk one square at a time?[/quote]They would not want to maintain an entire different application for consoles. They’d want it all to be one unified thing. So, either theyd implement a walking engine into their game for use on consoles (use a flag to control which engine to use), or they would find some way to make what they have work. I’m going with the latter.

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

Would they make a whole new walking system? or would we just walk one square at a time?

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:42, topic:293572”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=388440.msg2905924#msg2905924 date=1249795497]

srry but java runs on neither of those platforms so I doubt this will happen any time in the near future.

Wrong, the PS3 does have Java. Java is used in blu-ray technology (probably for menus in movies and such).

OK so what is preventing it from running right now? Does the web browser not support applets?
[/quote]

No the browser doesn’t, but that would be a simple update for Sony. Their browser is Mozilla-based and they can impose firmware updates anytime they want.

I doubt Jagex would go through a browser anyway. They’d probably make players buy a disk that installs RS on the local HDD. The client can then check for updates from the Jagex website and update itself accordingly. Wouldn’t be hard and would be easier than going through a browser.[/quote]And would yield more profit for them.

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:40, topic:293572”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=388440.msg2905827#msg2905827 date=1249787712]

srry but java runs on neither of those platforms so I doubt this will happen any time in the near future.

Wrong, the PS3 does have Java. Java is used in blu-ray technology (probably for menus in movies and such).
[/quote]
OK so what is preventing it from running right now? Does the web browser not support applets?[/quote]

No the browser doesn’t, but that would be a simple update for Sony. Their browser is Mozilla-based and they can impose firmware updates anytime they want.

I doubt Jagex would go through a browser anyway. They’d probably make players buy a disk that installs RS on the local HDD. The client can then check for updates from the Jagex website and update itself accordingly. Wouldn’t be hard and would be easier than going through a browser.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

the bank:

Xbox 360 has chatpad, my guess is they would build something like that themselves for whatever console it’s sold for, and make you buy that if you want to talk, otherwise only quick chat for you!

That’s true. I forgot about quick chat. But if they are using a console, they have more resources to add features like voice-to-text and such.

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:24, topic:293572”]The PS3 already has Java installed, so I’m sure they’re looking at that more than anything.

But to be honest, I would be the first to admit that RuneScape on the Wii would be epic…[/quote]

You just embedded an image of using a dds spec on the Wii in my head. I am excite.

Other than that this game will prolly sux and will have their own seperate servers. If any game, probably Mechscape will become a console game since it is more suited for one.

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

In my opinion, they’d start of with the history of RuneScape as a prelude, work through all the developments of Gielinor, and finish off with a transition to modern RuneScape.

Read full topic

item.title: JaGeX Bringing Runescape To Consoles
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“cane, post:28, topic:293572”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=388440.msg2904806#msg2904806 date=1249739366]
A Runescape movie wouldn’t be that bad. I mean, it would be quite a bit like LOTR combined with Beowulf and other similar movies.
[/quote]
What would be the concept of the movie? it would be more successful if it was in episodes of godwars, barrows, kalaphite queen etc… But no skilling that would be shit but then again so would the episodes.[/quote]

Skilling isn’t really part of the storyline of RS. I can’t really think of a good concept, but something like an adventure through the RS lands, a visit to the duel arena, maybe castle wars and ending up killing something big as the kalaphite queen or the barrows brothers.

Read full topic
